class_notes: In this course, students will practice a range of communication skills related to journalism. Specifically, students will practice strategies for writing, visualizing, and voicing information that is new, true, and medium specific. Students will also work on metacognitive skills such as tracking their time labor and writing with the goal of revising. Different parts of the course will focus on Emory as a site for local journalism, science journalism in the broader world, and solutions journalism as an approach for thinking about the future. No journalism background is required.
course_description: Students write and report for newspapers, radio, magazines, online sites and social media and develop websites to publish multimedia writing and news reports. They learn the basics of news writing and reporting, interviewing, and audio and video production. No journalism background required.
